snippet: Because of a slowing trend in health care spending, the government is expected to spend billions of dollars less than originally projected on the law, and future cost controls may save billions more.
abstract: Analysts say because of a slowing trend in health care spending, government is expected to spend billions of dollars less than originally projected on the Affordable Care Act; both Medicaid expansion and subsidies for private insurance plans will be less expensive than anticipated.
lead_paragraph: Because of a slowing trend in health care spending, the government is expected to spend billions of dollars less than originally projected on the law, and future cost controls may save billions more.

headline.main: Cost of Health Care Law Is Seen as Decreasing
headline.print_headline: Cost of Health Care Law Is Seen as Decreasing

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
